intro: Ternstroemia distyla, commonly known as the slender terebinth, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
